tournament.name: MTG SEA Championship Final 2025-26 - Oracle Events

decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards that interact with key cards in the opponent's deck. Additionally, the deck utilizes a few powerful spells to control the board and protect its own creatures. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan while also allowing for flexibility in casting all of its spells. The deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can establish a foothold or mount a comeback.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Solitude and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's spells, while utilizing cards like Quantum Riddler and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply pressure on the board. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. With a mix of disruption and aggression, this deck aims to control the game and secure a victory by overwhelming the opponent.

This aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding to control the board and finish off opponents. Leyline of the Guildpact and Doorkeeper Thrull provide additional support by boosting creature abilities. Consign to Memory and Stubborn Denial offer protection and disruption, while Winternight Stories can provide card advantage. The deck runs a mana base with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands for consistent color access and spell casting.

The deck utilizes a combination of instant reanimation spells and powerful creatures with beneficial abilities to quickly overwhelm opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format. By utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, players can bring back creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand from the graveyard to gain a significant advantage. The inclusion of cards like Solitude and Psychic Frog provide additional control elements, creating a versatile strategy that can adapt to different matchups. Additionally, the deck includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to disrupt opponents' game plans.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature strategies, utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck also includes support cards like Lightning Bolt and Consign to Memory to control the board and Leyline of the Guildpact to boost creature power. The mana base is constructed to provide a good mix of colored mana sources to support the deck's multicolor requirements. The inclusion of cards like Arid Mesa and Flooded Strand ensures consistency in mana fixing.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing cards like Ragavan and Scion of Draco, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact help in maintaining board control, while Stubborn Denial provides protection. Consign to Memory and Winternight Stories offer additional versatility. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Arena of Glory. Overall, the deck excels in applying pressure and closing out games swiftly.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures to put pressure on the opponent. By utilizing a mix of powerful creatures with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional protection and support for the aggressive strategy, while cards like Stubborn Denial offer disruption against opposing spells. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements, ensuring consistent and powerful plays throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing tokens created by Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate powerful creature synergies and overwhelm the opponent. By continuously boosting these creatures with Blade of the Bloodchief and Malevolent Rumble, the deck can quickly set up for a game-winning combo with Emrakul, the Promised End or Walking Ballista. The inclusion of cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Kozilek's Command provide additional utility and disruption options, while Urza's Saga helps to search for key combo pieces. Ultimately, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and execute its win condition swiftly.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to deploy threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury early on, while utilizing cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to hinder the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to maintain pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure victory.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan using taxing effects. The deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game by leveraging cards that have removal, bounce, and card draw effects. The key strategy is to use the synergy between the creatures and spells to steadily chip away at the opponent's life total and disrupt their strategy, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on using a combination of aggressive creatures like Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Solitude, to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game with its aggressive creatures. It also includes some removal and card draw to help maintain tempo and card advantage. The mana base includes a variety of land types to ensure consistent mana production.

This deck focuses on using a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It utilizes powerful threats like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer alongside removal spells such as Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory to keep the opponent on their back foot. Teferi, Time Raveler helps disrupt the opponent's strategy while cards like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies provide additional removal options. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game with its aggressive creatures.

The main concept of this Modern Merfolk deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing creatures with abilities that pump up other Merfolk, as well as disruptive spells like Consign to Memory and Sink into Stupor, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game while dealing consistent damage. The use of Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, while cards like Vodalian Hexcatcher and Tishana's Tidebinder provide additional control options. The inclusion of key Merfolk lords like Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis strengthens the deck's aggro potential.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Birthing Ritual spell to ramp up mana quickly and cast powerful creatures with disruptive abilities. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Ice-Fang Coatl, while also controlling the board with cards like Subtlety and Harbinger of the Seas. The inclusion of counterspells like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation help protect your creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and often, while maintaining flexibility and disruption to control the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient creatures and burn spells. It aims to control the board early on with cheap removal and disruptive spells, while maintaining card advantage through card draw and selection. The deck also includes ways to pump up its creatures and get additional value out of its spells. Overall, the deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and resource management to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells. It focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth to remove threats and deal damage, while also utilizing creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear to apply constant pressure. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and keep the opponent on the defensive, utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Slickshot Show-Off for card advantage and consistency. The mana base is designed to support a fast and consistent game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to have a strong control over the game through a combination of counterspells, powerful creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Magmatic Hellkite, and disruptive cards like Leyline Binding and Subtlety. The deck aims to gradually gain an advantage over the opponent by casting spells for free with Birthing Ritual and using cards like Shardless Agent to cascade into impactful spells. With versatile cards like Solitude and Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines, the deck can handle a variety of threats while maintaining board control.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combination of Amulet of Vigor and the various lands such as Crumbling Vestige, Urza's Saga, and Gruul Turf to generate massive amounts of mana quickly. This mana is then used to ramp into Primeval Titan and other powerful threats such as Malevolent Rumble, Aftermath Analyst, and Vexing Bauble. With the ability to search for key pieces with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Tolaria West, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and combo pieces.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cheat out big threats like Primeval Titan. The key strategy is to use land tutors like Scapeshift and Urza's Saga to find key lands like Gruul Turf and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect important combo pieces. Malevolent Rumble can be used to disrupt opponents and Spelunking can help dig for combo pieces. The deck also includes utility lands like Mirrorpool and Lotus Field to provide extra value and flexibility in gameplay.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride. The deck also includes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for attacks and finish off opponents. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional damage and disruption, while cards like Voice of Victory and Enduring Innocence offer versatility and protection. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with support from cards like Arid Mesa and Windswept Heath.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying constant pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Path to Exile, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and slow them down. Meanwhile, aggressive creatures like Flickerwisp, Emperor of Bones, and Overlord of the Balemurk put pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate to gain additional value from enters-the-battlefield abilities and control the board.

This deck focuses on rapidly deploying aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells. By combining powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer with control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and control the board. Using cards like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies to deal with threats, along with Consign to Memory for recursion, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent while also disrupting their strategy to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a fast and aggressive board presence. The deck utilizes a combination of disruptive creatures, removal spells, and card advantage engines to control the battlefield and apply pressure on the opponent. By combining efficient creatures like Ragavan and Phage with powerful spells like Consign to Memory and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to out-tempo the opponent and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of Teferi, Time Raveler also adds another layer of disruption and versatility to the strategy.

This Merfolk deck focuses on flooding the board with creatures and utilizing tribal synergies to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It includes disruptive elements like Merfolk Trickster and Tide Shaper to control the battlefield, along with powerful lords like Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis to boost the team. The deck also features some card draw and counterspells to maintain card advantage and protect its creatures. With efficient mana sources and a mix of aggressive and defensive elements, this deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo to secure victory.

Utilizing a combination of low-cost artifacts and efficient creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to accelerate mana production, the deck can quickly deploy threats such as Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary. Additionally, cards like Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and help maintain momentum. With a combination of explosive starts and resilient threats, this deck aims to capitalize on its synergy and proactive game plan to secure victories in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence by playing cheap artifacts and utilizing Urza's Saga to tutor for key pieces. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with multiple threats early in the game while disrupting their strategy with cards like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt. Additionally, the deck includes some control elements such as Metallic Rebuke and Sink into Stupor to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Finally, the inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Shadowspear provides additional versatility and disruption against a variety of matchups.

The deck aims to quickly generate mana with cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, cast spells like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual to create a storm count, before finishing the game with a large Grapeshot or Wish for lethal damage. The deck also includes card draw and copy effects like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Reckless Impulse to dig through the deck and find combo pieces. The inclusion of Past in Flames allows the player to potentially cast multiple spells in one turn from the graveyard, increasing the storm count even further for a decisive win.

This Ruby Storm deck focuses on quickly generating mana with Rituals, Medallions, and Manamorphose to cast powerful spells like Ral and Grapeshot. The deck uses cards like Valakut Awakening and Past in Flames to help dig for combo pieces and increase spell efficiency. It also includes Wish to access sideboard options when needed. With a mix of card draw, spell recursion, and explosive mana generation, this deck aims to combo off and burn opponents out quickly before they can respond.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying small, aggressive creatures and utilizing cheap spells to deal damage efficiently. By combining cheap creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter provide additional utility and potential for combo interactions, while cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge can be used to pump creatures and push through damage. The deck's low mana curve and spell efficiency allow for fast, explosive gameplay.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent's life total by playing aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while leveraging spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth to remove blockers and protect our creatures. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration, allowing for consistent aggression and efficient card selection. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth gameplay and maximize spell efficiency in order to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and Tron lands to quickly ramp up to big threats. It also includes disruption in the form of Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's win condition lies in overwhelming the opponent with large Eldrazi creatures and powerful planeswalkers like Karn and Ugin. The goal is to establish board control and close out the game with powerful threats while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's plans. The inclusion of cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Orim's Chant helps to limit the opponent's card advantage and prevent them from casting spells effectively. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Solitude and other powerful spells such as Supreme Verdict to close out the game once the opponent has been neutralized. Additionally, the deck benefits from the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard for additional synergy and value.
